glsa.title: ELinks: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in ELinks allowing for the user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: ELinks is a text-mode web browser.

description.p: Arnaud Giersch discovered that the "add_filename_to_string()" function in file intl/gettext/loadmsgcat.c uses an untrusted relative path, allowing for a format string attack with a malicious .po file.

impact.p: A local attacker could entice a user to run ELinks in a specially crafted directory environment containing a malicious ".po" file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ELinks.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
